title: Love Somebody Today
text:
Love Somebody Today is the fourth <a href="studio%20album">studio album</a> by the American <a href="R%26amp%3BB">R&B</a> vocal group <a href="Sister%20Sledge">Sister Sledge</a>, released on March 16, 1980 by <a href="Cotillion%20Records">Cotillion Records</a>. The album includes three <a href="Single%20%28music%29">singles</a>: "Got to Love Somebody", "Reach Your Peak", and "Let's Go on Vacation", which all charted on the US Pop and R&B/Soul charts from late 1979 until 1980.
Background.
Like their highly successful "<a href="We%20Are%20Family%20%28album%29">We Are Family</a>" released the previous year, this album was both written and produced by <a href="Nile%20Rodgers">Nile Rodgers</a> and <a href="Bernard%20Edwards">Bernard Edwards</a> of the band <a href="Chic%20%28band%29">Chic</a>. There were three singles released from this album. The first was "Got to Love Somebody" released in December 1979, which peaked at number sixty-four on the US Pop charts and number six on the R&B/Soul charts. In March 1980, the second single "Reach Your Peak" was released; peaking at #101 on the US Pop charts and #21 on the R&B/Soul charts. "Let's Go on Vacation", the last single released from this album failed to reach the US Pop chart but reached number sixty-three on the R&B/Soul chart. The latter was to be included on the Chic-produced soundtrack album "<a href="Soup%20for%20One%20%28soundtrack%29">Soup for One</a>" in 1982. "Love Somebody Today" was one of four albums to be written and produced by Edwards and Rodgers in 1980, the other three being <a href="Sheila%20%28and%29%20B.%20Devotion">Sheila and B. Devotion</a>'s "<a href="King%20of%20the%20World%20%28album%29">King of the World</a>" including its hit single "Spacer", Chic's fourth studio album "<a href="Real%20People%20%28album%29">Real People</a>" and <a href="Diana%20Ross">Diana Ross</a>' multi-platinum selling "<a href="diana%20%28album%29">diana</a>" which includes "<a href="Upside%20Down%20%28Diana%20Ross%20song%29">Upside Down</a>", "<a href="I%27m%20Coming%20Out">I'm Coming Out</a>" and "<a href="My%20Old%20Piano">My Old Piano</a>". "Love Somebody Today", along with six other Sister Sledge albums, was digitally remastered and reissued on CD in 2007 by <a href="Warner%20Bros.%20Records">Warner Bros. Records</a>.
The album reached #31 in the US Billboard Hot 100 Album chart.
Track listing.
All songs written by <a href="Bernard%20Edwards">Bernard Edwards</a> & <a href="Nile%20Rodgers">Nile Rodgers</a>.
